VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: An unexpected server error occurred, this may be a bug. These types of errors are unexpected therefore it should be reported to support
This error is raised when the client fails to provide the required ‘application_id’ parameter.
This error is raised when the client provides a Application ID that isn’t valid
The Application is suspended by the service provider
The Application is currently unavailable either from the service provider or the owner of this Application
This error is raised when the client fails to provide the required ‘redirect’ parameter when trying to request authentication to an Application that uses the “Redirect” authentication method
This error raises when the client provides a ‘redirect’ parameter containing a value that is not a valid URL. For example (https://example.com/) is valid but (foobar) is not.
The client provided an Authentication Access Token which does not exist with the service provider

The client is attempting to generate a Authentication Access Token using a Authentication Request Token which has already been used to create an Authentication Access Token. This process can only be done once, if you lose the Authentication Access Token then you must request Authentication to the user again.

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: INTERNAL SERVER ERROR WHILE TRYING TO AUTHENTICATE USER
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: This error is raised when an unexpected error is raised when the service provide was trying to authenticate the user with your Application, this incident should be reported to support.
This error is raised when the client fails to provide the required ‘secret_key’ parameter.
The client’s access has been denied by the service provider for failing to provide the correct secret key that’s associated with the Application ID.
This error is raised when the client fails to provide the required ‘access_token’ parameter.
This error happens when the client provides an Access Token which is invalid
This error happens when the account was deleted from the server either by the service provider or the user
The Access Token has expired due to lack of activity, the client must request authentication again and retrieve a new Access Token
The user’s account has been suspended by the service provider and is no longer available
The user revoked access to the Application, the Application must request authentication again.
The client has insufficient permissions to request access to this resource that it’s requesting
Due to user inactivity, the request token has expired and the Application must request authentication again
The service provider no longer supports this Application Authentication Type and the administrator of this Application must update their Authentication Type and their client to support it
This error is raised when the client fails to provide the required ‘request_token’ parameter.
This error is raised when the client provides an invalid Request Token

This isn’t an error, but rather a status-type error which indicates that the service provider is waiting for the user to authenticate. This will eventually result in an access token being granted or the request token being expired. The client should poll this request until a result has been returned.

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: ACCESS DENIED DUE TO SECURITY ISSUES
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: The service provider may deny access to a users account when it believes the user’s security is at risk and the user must review their account in order to fix this issue, this can range from Government-backed attacks to a compromised account
